poem:
**The Bonus**  

Profits teeter, swollen with their own weight,  
a penny spins on edge—heads or tails—no time to tilt  
toward those who shoulder shelves and tally tills.  
A third year stretches its thin, barren shadow  
over aisles of whispered want; the waiting game,  
where tills ring out all promises, none fulfilled,  
a queue as long as hope's retreating tail.
